intro: Ischnosiphon densiflorus, commonly known as the dense-flowered ischnosiphon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Ischnosiphon densiflorus is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories or along stream banks.
